channel.title: Ideas on 1st car?
channel.description:
I've finally got round to starting to drive, and seeing as my parents both have big, automatic BMW's I don't have a car I can use outside of lessons. I'm looking for a car thats going to cost less than £1000 second hand, is reliable, isn't going to cost a shit load to insure, and isn't stupidly slow. I'm aiming to get a 1.4l engine, but 1.2's are fine. My initial idea was to get an old Ford Focus or Fiesta, but I really want something a little bit different.
Has anyone got any ideas for a good, reliable first car?

item.title: Ideas on 1st car?
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:65, topic:310884”][quote author=Mr.Chris link=topic=407345.msg3047743#msg3047743 date=1259883706]
after all this time, I ended up settling for a Vauxhall Corsa 1.2l. It’s 15 years old, with 100,000 miles on the clock, but it is in excellent condition with only 1 previous lady owner. Only £450 which was cheap and cheerful!
[/quote]
damn thats a seriously used car
my insurance is 1600 for my own insurance with parents as named drivers i also have a 1.2l corsa, 40,000miles and its '97[/quote]

11000KM a year is not a seriously used car, more like 60000km a year. 30000 a year is average.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Insurance as a named driver on a provisional liscense cost me £850. I’m guessing that when I pass my test is will cost around £1300, but if I do Pass Plus, i’ll get a hundred or so £ knocked off.

item.title: Ideas on 1st car?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“the bank, post:59, topic:310884”][quote author=Explisionist link=topic=407345.msg3025968#msg3025968 date=1257919347]
For the U.S Pontiac’s are good. They are a average of 25/35 mpg, and are fast, and reliable.

For you go with the Fiesta, although I have never seen/heard of one. But you gotta love the British cars. Lol
[/quote]Pontiac’s aren’t reliable.[/quote]

Don’t know where that came from, srt8’s 1996 Pontiac Grand Am gets 32mpg and has 135,000 miles on it with very few problems ever. Also, though my S10 is a Chevy (Chevy and Pontiac are both GM), it had 314,000 miles on it before the original 4.3 V6 blew, I put another engine it it and still drive it to this day.

Bottom line, they are very reliable.

Read full topic

I’m shocked at the cheapness of cars in the US. I’m spending nearly £2000 just to get an old banger on the road…that’s not even including running costs…

Well, there’s a nice Fiesta in good condition down the road, and will probably buy it in a few days…Thanks for the help again.[/quote]
my car was £210, and needs about £90 worth of repairs, is perfect first car

item.title: Ideas on 1st car?
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:42, topic:310884”]$300 a year for insurance? My 1999 Toyota Camry CSX which has a 2.2L engine costs me ~$1100AUD (roughly $1000USD or $600GBP).

As for petrol costs, Australia peaked at around $1.75AUD (~$1.60USD). It currently sits at $1.40 or less, AUD.

It’s ridiculous in Australia. Insurance is so high because of all the fuckwit 17 year olds who think they can drive and then end up wrapping their car and themselves around a pole.
At least we’re doing alright petrol-wise.

On another note, a case of pure blondes (24 beers) costs about $40 AUD ($36USD) – how does that compare to the rest of the world? :P[/quote]Depends on what brand obviously, but i’d say around $30 here. I’d rather go to germany and buy my beer, there i can get 3x24 for $10 or so (even the more expensive shit beer like Heineken)

Read full topic

item.title: Ideas on 1st car?
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

la­wl:

oh yeah, forgot to mention that $300 a month is if you are the primary driver… its probably around $100 if you are a secondary driver

Oh ok. That’s only $100 more than I’m paying each year then. I’m a secondary driver (and I’ll probably keep it that way for a few more years), despite being the only person that drives the car.

Read full topic

item.title: Ideas on 1st car?
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“la­wl, post:44, topic:310884”][quote author=Lothy link=topic=407345.msg3019710#msg3019710 date=1257512473]
$300 a year for insurance? My 1999 Toyota Camry CSX which has a 2.2L engine costs me ~$1100AUD (roughly $1000USD or $600GBP).

As for petrol costs, Australia peaked at around $1.75AUD (~$1.60USD). It currently sits at $1.40 or less, AUD.

It’s ridiculous in Australia. Insurance is so high because of all the fuckwit 17 year olds who think they can drive and then end up wrapping their car and themselves around a pole.
At least we’re doing alright petrol-wise.

On another note, a case of pure blondes (24 beers) costs about $40 AUD ($36USD) – how does that compare to the rest of the world?
[/quote]

i think a 24pack of pint sized heinekens is around $40 or $50 here in canada…

about $300 a month insurance if you’ve just got your license[/quote]
$300 a month is incredible. $3600 in a 12 month period covers what exactly? My car was $6500, and I couldn’t fathom paying half of its value for insurance in just 12 months when I’m a good driver.

Sounds like your alcohol/beer pricing is on par with Australia’s. I just wanted to know if our government was staying in line with the rest of the world or going way overboard with taxing us.

@R.I.P: I’d say they’re normal. Maybe a few dollars dearer than stuff like Carlton Draught and the like, but $10 cheaper than a case of coronas. Europe has really cheap grog.

Read full topic
